forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the transient heart of Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon greets us with a mostly sunny disposition, casting a gentle warmth against the backdrop of a vibrant cityscape. The air, freshened by a westerly breeze, carries a subtle promise of the shifting weather ahead. As the sun prepares to settle, the temperature drifts downwards, offering a pleasant contrast to the coolness of 51 degrees that will embrace the night. Yet, as evening approaches, the clouds begin to gather, thickening in anticipation of what lies within the forecast—a rain that will wash away the day and offer new reflections by dawn.

With a light jacket or a cozy sweater, one can enjoy a stroll through the streets, perhaps indulging in a quiet coffee at a nearby café, savoring the shift of day to night as the city lights begin to flicker alive. While the first hints of rain may start to feather in after hours, the initial clarity of the sky invites exploration before the clouds roll in. As you wander, take note of the familiar landmarks, each imbued with a sense of calm before the oncoming storm, allowing the urban rhythm to wrap around you like a soft blanket. In this moment, the city is poised between sunshine and rain, an ever-changing canvas where serenity meets the inevitable.
